answers.answer: Yes... hey usualy break ur water when they r gettin the baby out.. and some ppl have csections cuz they r not dilating.i have had two nd this will b my third.

well Last night i went to get check because I was having signs of early labor. i went in and they checked me but said I wasnt even 1cm dialated. Plus Ive never had problems with my blood pressure but lately its high. they never do anything but send me home. ive been having bad back labor as well. I was wanting to have baby normal but lately ive been in so much pain i actually wouldnt mind a c-section. I really want one... ugh. idk what to do.

How far along are you? Back pain is very common during the last trimester, so if they're checking you out and sending you home it's because you're not dilating with your contractions, and back pain, meaning it's not real labor. BH can be very uncomfortable. Unless you're at least 40 weeks, some will let you go 41 before they talk about induction, or c-section. Most doctors won't let you just do an elective c-section, some insurances don't cover it if it's elective. I would really, really try natural first. I had a c-section and I had a much better experience than most do, but it's a very major abdominal surgery, and you have to keep that in mind with recovery (it's going to hurt more than back labor) and with future pregnancies. Good luck!!

How far along are you? My doc doesn't offer voluntary csection unless it is a repeat. Other wise you might need a medical reason. No worries it is perfectly normal to have anxiety and fears about an up coming labor of any kind.

Have u tried primrose oil.. how far are u... try that and rasberry leaf tea.... wqlkung... bouncing..sex nipple stimulation...etc... but i dunno ifthey will jus do a csection cause you want one ask ur doc about it.... my first was emergency and the second and third was.scheduled.

Im 36+3. My doctor is always telling me that my nlood pressure is really high and it worries her but yet she does nothing. I lately have been in SO much pain.. The doctors or nurses dont even both really offering meds to help. Also my baby has been having a Really fast heartbeat. it just really scares me. but my doctor wont do anything about any thing... im just so tired and exhausted.

At 36+3 (unless your BP was dangerously high, in which case they'd HAVE to deliver you, because you and your baby can both get very, very sick, or die from that, and that would be a liability on them) they won't induce or deliver you. With your first, again unless your BP gets dangerously high, they won't let you deliver til at least 39 weeks. How high was your BP the last time? It may be elevated but not enough to signify preeclampsia, or you may have just elevated BP and no other signs of preeclampsia, in that case they won't deliver you just yet. The last trimester really *****, try to take it easy, take tylenol, baths, heating pads and relax as much as you can. It's almost over!
Its uasually 141/88. or one time it was higher. plus my heart gets to racing ALOT.  The babies heart beat got up to 208 last night.. I try tylenol, heating pads, baths and NOTHING works...

That is pretty high for your BP, but unless your showing other signs of preeclampsia they can't induce or give you the option of a c-section yet (unless you go into labor on your own). Heart palpitations are normal during pregnancy, I get them ALL the time, I have had them with both pregnancies and have had healthy pregnancies each time. That H/B isn't safe, though. Most doctors will agree anything over 180-190 isn't safe.. is there another doctor you could see or switch to? Have you talked to your doctor about your concern about how high that was? I'm 4'11 and my last baby was almost 9lbs, so I can relate to nothing working with pain, unfortunately that's most of us our last trimester. Have you tried anything to induce yourself naturally? Primrose oil? Walking? Sex? Bouncing on a ball? That might help. If you go into labor now they won't stop it.
Im not trying to sound stupid.. lol but what is Primrose oil and how do you use it and how does it work?

Honestly I never tried it so I'm not the best one to ask about that, haha. I know you can take it vaginally or orally and it's supposed to progress your cervix and help you go into labor. For some women it happens very quickly, for some it takes a little longer. I'd look it up online, primrose oil to induce labor, you can buy it right at a pharmacy and it's worth a shot!

Well im on medicaid so unless I change the name of my dr they wont let me see other drs.. Ity to tell and ask my dr questions but she wont reply or when she does shes like its normal... ugh.. my appts dont even last over 5mins.. Ive tried sex and walking and still nothing.

You aren't full term. Doctors won't induce you before 39w without medical necessity. Your bp is high, but it's right on the borderline. Your baby's heart rate is high, but if your doctor isn't concerned there's not much you can do. Most insurances won't cover an elective c section, and again... If your dr won't induce you right now, they won't do a c section either. They also don't like to prescribe pain medication unless its absolutely necessary.  And nothing you do like walking, sex, primrose oil, or anything else will put you into labor if your body and baby isn't ready.

It *****, it really does but it's just part of pregnancy. Your BP is elevated, but if you're in the pain you claim that alone can (and for many will) send it through the roof. The thing is pain and discomfort during or at the end of pregnancy is normal - you're carrying a large child, fluid and everything else. It won't be a cake walk. Just make sure to take it easy, you don't have much longer. A c-section won't help your pain, it'll just add to it and make things harder.

question: okay, So Im a FTM so Im not sure how some things go. This might be a stupid question but Idk.. Can your Dr still do a c section even if your water hasnt broke or your not dialating?
title: C-Section Question.
